II.i.2.A.2.c
.
Checking for the Proper Signature
A complete claim for any type of benefit must be signed by the
claimant
parent or guardian of a minor, or
fiduciary of a claimant who is incompetent.
Exceptions
:
An authorized representative may prepare and submit certain non-original claims on behalf of the claimant without the claimant’s signature as noted in
M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, 2.A.4.b
.
An alternate signer may sign a claim on behalf of the claimant in certain situations as discussed in
M21-1, Part II, Subpart i, 2.B.3
.
Important
:
VA accepts signatures on applications that are photocopied or faxed.
VA waives the signature requirement when a claim is filed electronically by the claimant through a VA claims-submission service website.
References
:  For more information on
processing on-line applications without a signature, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart i, 2.A.2.d
claimant signatures, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart i, 2.B.2
, and
signature requirements for burial claims, see
M21-1, Part XI, Subpart iii, 1.A.4.a
.
